content: in this legal case one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs although the exact amount was not specified the plaintiff is requesting the division of joint property located in tallinn they want to sell the property through a public auction and divide the proceeds equally between them and the defendant alternatively the plaintiff is willing to leave the property solely to the defendant if the defendant pays half of the propertys value in cash the defendant contests the value of the property and requests an expert to determine its value they also argue that the joint ownership should be terminated and that the defendant should compensate the plaintiff for their share of the money used for the joint property the court will make a decision based on the evidence presented by both parties and the relevant laws the defendant provides evidence to prove that they used their separate property to benefit the joint property they also want to divide additional common property mentioned in the lawsuit the defendant has submitted a written testimony regarding a sum of money given to them in 1997 the court finds this evidence convincing and orders the defendant to compensate the plaintiff for the value of their separate property the court also needs to determine how to divide the common property the court decides that it is fair for the defendant to compensate the plaintiff for their share of the property and allows the defendant to keep the property the court concludes that the common property should be sold at a public auction and the proceeds should be divided equally between the parties each party is ordered to bear their own procedural costs except for the experts cost in determining the market value of the property which the plaintiff is ordered to pay the court determines the amount of procedural costs based on the civil procedure code the county court will determine the financial amount of procedural costs in the judgment ruling taking into account the division of common property
